intro: Jasione lusitanica, commonly known as the Iberian bellflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe, particularly Portugal and Spain. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone soils and thrives in sunny, well-drained environments. Jasione lusitanica has slender, hairy stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. It is often found in open woodlands and grasslands, and it plays a role in supporting local pollinators.
